module.name: Daily Life
module.description: Learn vocabulary for family, food, everyday objects, and time expressions.

lessons.title: Family and Daily Words
lessons.description: Learn essential vocabulary for family members, common foods, and household items.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'mother' in Spanish?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Madre' is mother. 'Mamá' is the informal version.

quiz_questions.question: What does 'hermano' mean?
How do you say 'water' in Spanish?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Agua' means water. Note: it uses 'el' despite being feminine.

quiz_questions.question: What is 'pan' in English?
How do you say 'table' in Spanish?

lessons.title: Possessives and Ser vs Estar
lessons.description: Learn possessive adjectives and the difference between ser and estar.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'my mother' in Spanish?
Which verb is used for permanent characteristics?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Ser' is used for permanent states (nationality, profession, etc.).

quiz_questions.question: 'Estoy cansado' uses estar because being tired is:
Complete: 'La casa ___ grande' (permanent quality)
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Es' (ser) for permanent characteristics of the house.

quiz_questions.question: Complete: 'Mi padre ___ en la cocina' (location)
How do you say 'our house'?
'Soy estudiante' means:
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Soy' (ser) + profession = I am a student (permanent role).

quiz_questions.question: Which is correct: 'La leche es/está fría'?
quiz_questions.explanation: Both work: 'es fría' (milk is cold by nature) vs 'está fría' (currently cold).

lessons.title: Family Conversations
lessons.description: Practice talking about your family and daily routines.

quiz_questions.question: How do you ask 'Do you have siblings?' in Spanish?
How do you say 'I live with my family'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Vivo con mi familia' - 'vivir' means to live.

quiz_questions.question: What does '¿Qué hora es?' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: '¿Qué hora es?' asks for the time.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'It's 3 o'clock'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Son las tres' - use 'son' for all hours except 1:00 (es la una).

quiz_questions.question: How do you respond to '¿Cuántos hermanos tienes?'
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Tengo tres hermanos' answers how many siblings you have.

lessons.title: Reading About Daily Life
lessons.description: Read and understand texts about family and daily routines.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Mi familia es grande. Tengo tres hermanos.' How many siblings?
Read: 'Desayuno a las ocho de la mañana.' When does the person eat breakfast?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'A las ocho' means at eight o'clock.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Mi madre cocina todos los días.' What does the mother do?
Read: 'Vivimos en una casa pequeña pero cómoda.' The house is:
Read: 'Los domingos, almorzamos con los abuelos.' When do they lunch with grandparents?

lessons.title: Days and Time Expressions
lessons.description: Learn to understand days of the week and time expressions.

quiz_questions.question: Which day sounds like 'LOO-nes'?
How do you say 'Saturday' in Spanish?
Spanish days of the week are:
quiz_questions.explanation: Unlike English, Spanish days are not capitalized.

quiz_questions.question: What does 'el fin de semana' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'El fin de semana' literally means 'the end of the week' = weekend.

quiz_questions.question: Which day sounds like 'MYER-ko-les'?
